meanings.definition: To expose to danger or risk.
meanings.sent1: She was hazarding her safety by walking alone at night.
meanings.sent2: He knew he was hazarding his life by not wearing a seatbelt.
meanings.sent3: The cat was hazarding a fall as it balanced on the narrow ledge.
meanings.sent4: By not studying for the test, he was hazarding his chances of passing.
meanings.sent5: The reckless driver was hazarding the lives of everyone on the road.

meanings.definition: To take a chance or gamble.
meanings.sent1: I was hazarding a guess when I said it would rain today.
meanings.sent2: She was hazarding her luck by entering the lottery.
meanings.sent3: He was hazarding a bet on the football game's outcome.
meanings.sent4: By investing in that stock, he was hazarding his savings.
meanings.sent5: The explorer was hazarding a journey into the unknown.

meanings.sent1: She was hazarding a new business venture.
meanings.sent2: He was hazarding a trip to the remote mountain peak.
meanings.sent3: The children were hazarding an adventure into the dark forest.
meanings.sent4: By accepting the challenge, he was hazarding a difficult task.
meanings.sent5: The scientist was hazarding a groundbreaking experiment.
